data.meta_site_name: CHATEAUGUAY VALLEY LITERACY COUNCIL ALPHABETISATION DE CHATEAUGUAY VALLEY
data.text:
LEARNING TO READ GIVES ONE THE ABILITY TO LEARN JUST ABOUT ANYTHING!

Vision

To help and encourage members of our community to develop skills for lifelong learning enabling them to reach their full potential.

Mission

To help individuals, families, and youth improve their reading, writing, listening, speaking, numeracy and other life skills through programs adapted meet to their needs.

To recruit and train committed volunteers as tutors and support members.

OUR STAFF

Over the years, both have attended conferences, workshops and webinars in order to keep abreast of new literacy programs, teaching approaches and online materials. In addition, they teach on a regular basis as well as develop programs and classroom materials.

Because of their love of teaching and in an effort to help individuals with a literacy issue, they have given more than 3,000 hours in office and tutoring time over the past 5 years.

OUR BOARD

CVLC has a board of five volunteers drawn from the community who serve a two-year term. It consists of the President, the Vice-President, the Treasurer, the Secretary and a General Officer. They oversee all activities and expenditures and plan for future projects. We have one member who is our "historical memory" having volunteered with CVLC in a variety of positions for the past 15 years.

LITERACY IN CANADA, ​2003 -2006

PROPORTION OF ADULT PROSE LITERACY AT LEVEL 2 AND BELOW - AGE 16 AND OLDER

OUR HISTORY

CVLC started in the early 1980's as a home-based activity helping adults in the Chateauguay area learn to read and write.

The majority of people involved as volunteers are women.

Over the years it grew to involve many people in Chateauguay, Kahnawake, and the Valley.

In 1989 CVLC was awarded a grant from the Quebec Ministry of Education to sustain and increase its activities.

At its outset, CVLC adopted the Laubach Vision for one-on-one tutoring for literacy learners.

It now prides itself as the only community organization in Chateauguay that deals with English-speaking clients who need support in literacy and literacy-type activities.

CVLC : CHATEAUGUAY VALLEY LITERACY COUNCIL

Alphabétisation de Chateauguay Valley
